description: Given a text in natural language with statements or arguments, a type of formal logic to use ('Propositional', 'FirstOrder' or 'Modal'), a belief set to be parsed, a query to be tested, and the result of the query processed by the Tweety logic library, interprets the result into a reasoned answer in natural language

parameters.name: input
parameters.description: The natural language text to analyse

parameters.name: logicType
parameters.description: The type of logic to use for conversion: available options are 'Propositional', 'FirstOrder' or 'Modal'

parameters.name: belief_set
parameters.description: The belief set on which the query will be run/tested, to be parsed for selected logic type

parameters.name: query
parameters.description: The query to test as a formula string to parse for selected logic type

parameters.name: tweety_result
parameters.description: The result of the query run in Tweety
